description: Identifier of the maintenance template or task model this task belongs to; used to group tasks for a PM program.
Schedule identifier within the template, indicating the service interval or grouping this task belongs to; likely default when unscheduledâ€”confirm with SME.
Task number unique within the template or schedule, used as a human-readable step ID.
Execution/display sequence controlling the order in which tasks appear or are performed.
Concise description of the maintenance action or inspection to perform.
Type of result to capture for this task (e.g., pass/fail, numeric, text); controls input and validation. Confirm allowed codes with SME.
Meter category or unit associated with this task (e.g., hours, miles, cycles); may drive scheduling or data capture. Confirm code set with SME.
Reference to an attachment (document, image, instruction) linked to this task.
Optional calculation expression used to derive task results, thresholds, or cost allocations. Confirm syntax and scope with SME.
Flag indicating whether completion of this task is mandatory to close the work order or checklist.
Numeric portion or percentage of total job cost attributed to this task for costing and reporting. Confirm units with SME.
Code representing the hierarchical level or grouping of this task within the checklist (parent/subtask structure). Confirm code meanings with SME.
User ID of the creator of this record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User ID of the person who last updated the record.
Timestamp when the record was last updated.
External or system-generated identifier for the task, distinct from sequence/number; may map to OEM or corporate standards. Confirm usage with SME.
Estimated labor hours required to complete the task.
User-defined text field for implementation-specific notes or codes.
Flag indicating the task or template is shared and reusable across sites, assets, or fleets.
